dialog_029: Is there anything else four times here?

dialog_045: Isn't it interesting that they're four
dialog_053: And what if it's not about what's in them.

dialog_011: Rest restored some of your health.

dialog_000: Hello. Do you need any help?
dialog_006: Good day.
We're tracking carts with supplies. They haven't
arrived at their destination. Have you seen them by any chance?
dialog_011: A few days ago, local bandits clashed
with soldiers over the carts here.
The whole gang pounced on them.
dialog_016: And do you happen to know where those
carts might have been taken?
dialog_021: But of course I do.
To the east of the forest, the bandits have
a hideout in the ruins of an old castle.
But you won't get there by the usual route.
dialog_026: They have many guards there. But there's also
a forest path along the stream from the south.
dialog_047: Rest restored some of your health.

dialog_007: Hey fisherman, could you ferry us
to the other side?
dialog_012: And will you pay me for it?
dialog_020: Sure, here's 10 gold coins.

dialog_001: Welcome to the Hollow Oak.
My name is Thomas, and I run
the shop and tavern here.
dialog_006: Are you alright? The area around the village
is full of bandits. Do you need accommodation?
dialog_014: How can I assist you this time?
dialog_035: Rest restored some of your health.
dialog_049: Sure, but we're a bit short on funds right now.
dialog_054: I'll let you spend the night at least
in the hayloft behind the tavern.
dialog_060: Poor rest didn't do you much good.
dialog_072: Could you give us some advice?
dialog_077: Of course, miss. To the west of the forest is
an old tower. And from there, a secret forest
path leads. But it's not entirely safe there

dialog_000: we better not get too close to it.
The shortcut should be around here somewhere.
Hopefully, we're in the right place.
dialog_006: Ha! Easy prey.
Get them, guys.
dialog_028: Next time we need to be better prepared.

everything we needed there.

the bandit leaders. We'll tell Vaughn
where they should pickup their carts.

You entered the Main Hall.
dialog_006: Jakob, be really careful here.
If we stay here too long, the fishfolk
will catch us, and it'll be over for us.

dialog_000: The fishfolk leaders are in this tent.
dialog_005: Let's go for them. Once we get rid
of them, there won't be anyone left
who would want to stay here.
dialog_016: Let's get out of here.
The leaders are gone, I don't want to be
here when they start packing up the whole camp.
dialog_021: And things moved quickly.
As our party was leaving, the fishfolk were already
loading the first boats. The plan worked.

dialog_001: You can skip by pressing [SPACE]

dialog_005: But we never returned from there.

dialog_000: With the help of our party, Camilla got into
the pirates' camp. When she described to everyone
how she drove the evil fishfolk out of their lair,
they cheered for her and elected her their leader again.
dialog_005: Camilla kept her word, and the pirate
siege ended the same day.
dialog_010: Thank you, my friends, for your help.
I'll head to the capital in the morning;
it was nice meeting you.
dialog_015: Not so fast, handsome.
Firstly, as I said, I'm going there too.
And secondly, I won't take my eyes off you
until I'm sure you're home and safe.
dialog_020: That's right, Jakob.
We're going with you until the end.
Even if it just means making sure
you've arrived safely.
dialog_025: I'm speechless, thank you. Of course,
I'll gladly have your company.
So let's go to Vaughn, then
to arrange the ship.
dialog_030: In the morning, Vaughn sent a courier ship
to the capital. For news and necessary supplies.
We all set sail on its deck.
dialog_035: After a few days of journeying down the river,

dialog_002: This doesn't look good.
All the windows are shut, and so many guards.
It's as if the city is afraid of something.
dialog_007: Do you think that mysterious knight
is still in your palace?
Should we ask the guards?
dialog_012: I'd rather not. The last thing
we need now is a nervous soldier
aiming a weapon at us.
dialog_017: Agreed.
Let's try to avoid the soldiers
and first find out what's going on.
dialog_022: That house at the western end of the port.
My father lives there in that passage.
Maybe we'll learn something there.
dialog_031: The Master lives in the northeast part of the city.

dialog_000: My Master lives there. But we
don't need anything from there now.
I don't remember this house being like this.
We're done here. Where to next?

dialog_011: Hi, Jakob. Robert said you might stop by.
Come in.
dialog_017: Hello, Matthew. Long time no see.
Thanks for opening up for us.
dialog_022: No problem. Glad to help. So, what do you need?
dialog_039: Feel free to drop by again.

dialog_001: Let's get to it then.
dialog_006: Adventure awaits.

dialog_005: They questioned us for a few days. When they found out
who I was, they assigned us to defend the city.
dialog_010: But for the princess, it was too late.

dialog_001: Hey, brother.
dialog_007: Jakob!
Welcome back, that's amazing,
we were afraid we'd never see you again.
dialog_012: Robert, I just arrived by a ship
from Silver Estuary. It's a long
story. Is father here?
dialog_017: Father is out hunting. He won't be back
for at least a few days. They say the palace
was hit by some magic, we were afraid it got
you too. Soldiers are guarding the city now.
dialog_022: I'll explain everything to you when we have
a little more time. If the palace is still under
the magic, I must act first.
dialog_027: Jakob, if there's magic involved, my
master might advise us. He lives here
in the city, I know where.
dialog_032: Alright, let's go see him first then.
Can we use you as a temporary base,
brother? So we have somewhere to stay?
dialog_037: Of course, but be careful. If your master
is a wizard, he's probably in trouble.
At the beginning, soldiers went after
anyone they knew had magical powers.
dialog_042: Jakob, you go with Sabrina and I'll
check out the palace in the meantime.
I'll be more sneaky on my own and maybe I'll find out more.
dialog_066: Better go out through the side entrance
so the guards don't catch you.

dialog_001: So we're back, brother.
dialog_021: So I'm here too. How did it go?
dialog_026: We have a plan to get into the palace.
If we manage to find the entrance
to the old tunnels under the city.
dialog_031: I saw one in the northwest
part of the city, by the moat.
dialog_041: I'm boiling water for tea. Oh, I also
arranged with our neighbor who runs
the shop that you can drop by there.
dialog_046: If you find your way into the palace,
you might \C[10]not be able to return\C[0].
dialog_057: Go out through the side entrance again,
so the guards don't catch you.

dialog_017: Be careful!
Ha, someone's in the kitchen!
Look, a fireplace. We could
rest here if needed.

dialog_001: Locked. Do you know where the key could be?
dialog_006: Well, I know that the housekeeper kept spare keys
hidden in the kitchen. Those are the first
doors on the right by the entrance to the house.

dialog_001: I think we have what we need.
Let's get out of here. We'll go to Robert's, meet
up with John, and make a plan.

dialog_005: We're not done here yet.

dialog_001: Hm. Looks like they had some unwelcome guests here.
Do you think your master is still around?
dialog_006: There's a chance, but slim. He-ll-oo!
Probably not. Still, search it here
is our best chance.
dialog_011: The cellar is on the left, the kitchen on the right.
But we should probably just go straight to
the library at the end of the hallway.
dialog_016: My master had a secret entrance to his
study in the library. If we can find any clues,
they're likely there.
dialog_022: Watch out!
dialog_028: Alright, that was an Imp. There might be
more of them here. We should be cautious.
dialog_033: Imp. Like those magical creatures from hell
our parents scared us with? Surely not.
dialog_038: Well, more like a dimensional fire elemental,
no hell included, but yes. Imp.
dialog_043: Dime- what? Never mind. It seems like slicing
with a sword didn't bother them much, and they
were just having fun with fire.

dialog_000: To the left is the master's study and bedroom.
To the right is the dining room. The library is
dialog_005: Watch out, unwelcome guests!

dialog_000: These are the stairs to the upper floor
dialog_005: And a welcoming committee too!

dialog_000: This is where the housekeeper hides the spare keys.
I'll take the key from the library.
Ha, they're in the library too. Get them!
dialog_006: Hmm. Looks like the entrance to the study
is closed. Alright, it opens with
an alchemical spell. And for that,
we need red and blue tincture.
dialog_011: Most of the time, the master keeps them
in his bedroom or in the study. Those
are the rooms on the left. When we find them,
I'll explain what to do with them.

dialog_000: Excellent, that's one of the tinctures.
dialog_008: So we have both.
Now we can go back to the library.

dialog_000: Do you think I can take it?
dialog_005: Well, we're finding out what happened to him,
so yes. Feel free to take it, just return
it to him when we find him, if it suits you.

dialog_000: Hmm, free food is not to be sniffed at.
Excellent, that's one of the tinctures.
dialog_008: So we have both.
Now we can go back to the library.
Decent sum of money. Should we borrow it?
dialog_016: But we'll return it once we
find the master. Clear?

dialog_009: Beautiful bow. John will love this one.

dialog_001: So which one should I pour here?
dialog_008: No! Don't mess it up!
dialog_021: This side is done.

dialog_000: Pour red into the left one, blue into the right.
Just pour a little of those tinctures.
Then I'll say the magic formula.

dialog_001: So which one should I pour here?
dialog_012: No! Don't mess it up!
dialog_021: This side is done.

dialog_011: Let's do this.
dialog_020: And it's done.

dialog_000: Just don't be afraid. Jump in.
dialog_014: We're here. Well, there's quite a mess here.
I wonder how we'll find anything.
dialog_019: Navigating through mess is easier when you know
how it looked when it was tidy. Then you know
for example that this thing is new here. Bingo.
dialog_024: Looks like research notes. The master
was studying the barrier surrounding the castle.
And there's also how to penetrate it.
Perfect. Let's take the notes and go.

dialog_005: Yeah, I remember we used to come here
to look at the palace gardens.
Come on, we have work to do.

dialog_009: A small chest. And there's some
money in it. That'll come in handy.

dialog_001: We have wood now.
We can't carry everything with us.
But when we come back, we'll
know that it's here.

dialog_013: We can set up a campsite here,
if we have wood, that is.

dialog_000: I bet we need to go
dialog_005: See that lever? Maybe it opens that grate.

dialog_015: Alright, so we need to put

dialog_001: We have wood now.

dialog_000: Hmm, this lever is broken, it won't budge.

dialog_009: Chainmail cap!
Escape ring!
Regeneration ring!
Helmet!

dialog_007: I'm back.

dialog_005: As far as I can see, the ride isn't over yet.
Sabrina, this isn't the palace. Where are we?
dialog_010: It's okay, I expected this. Don't worry.
In short, we're inside the magic
that surrounds the palace.
dialog_015: The spell is resisting being broken, and it's creating
a maze of magic for my penetration formulas.
And what we see is an attempt of my senses
to understand what surrounds us.
dialog_020: Okay. What do you need from us?
dialog_025: Actually, I'll need your help. In this
representation, there are four pyramids
that the spell has hidden from me.
Four pyramids, each containing an amulet.
dialog_030: If we collect all the amulets, I'll break the spell
and we'll be in the palace.
dialog_035: And what about that Tower over here?
dialog_040: That's precisely the symbol of the locked spell.
Once we have the amulets, we'll come here
and unlock that tower with them.
Watch out, imps might also be here.

dialog_001: We've got it!
Hooray, an amulet!
Well, would you look at that. We have the Amulet.
Great. We have the Amulet.

dialog_000: I'll unlock this tower when we get all
four amulets. So far, we have \V[19].
dialog_005: The amulets are in the pyramids,
somewhere in this maze.

dialog_011: So we have all the amulets now.
Are you ready to storm the palace?
dialog_028: So we have all the amulets now.
But first, I should call back the party.

dialog_000: Across the corridor here is the armory,
maybe we could quickly stop by.

dialog_005: Perfect. This is right next to the princess's
chambers. Just down the hallway and to the left.

dialog_002: So, with whom?

dialog_000: So what do you need then?
